HarPy API¶

To read a header-array file (HAR) from disk, use the static method loadFromDisk(filename). This will return an instance of harpy.HarFileObj(), which is a subclass of dict.

To write a HAR file to disk, first create an harpy.HarFileObj() object, and then execute the writeToDisk() method. Those methods, and other API methods, are shown below.

class harpy.HarFileObj(*args, *, filename: str = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

HAR file object - essentially a memory representation of a HAR file.

HarFileObj subclasses dict, and stores a list of harpy.HeaderArrayObj in self. Each harpy.HeaderArrayObj corresponds to a header-array. If HarFileObj is provided with filename, then the header-arrays in that file will be loaded - i.e. each harpy.HeaderArrayObj in self will correspond to a header-array in that file.

addHeaderArrayObj(ha_obj: harpy.header_array.HeaderArrayObj, idx: int = None)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • ha_obj – A harpy.HeaderArrayObj object.
  • idx – The index of self["head_arrs"] at which to insert ha_obj.
addHeaderArrayObjs()[source]¶
Parameters:ha_objs ('List[harpy.HeaderArrayObj]') – Add one or more harpy.HeaderArrayObj to self.
getHeaderArrayNames()[source]¶
Returns:Returns the name of all harpy.HeaderArrayObj() stored with self.
getHeaderArrayObj(ha_name: str)[source]¶

Retrieve a single harpy.HeaderArrayObj.

Parameters:ha_name – The "name" of the harpy.HeaderArrayObj.
Returns:A harpy.HeaderArrayObj.
getHeaderArrayObjIdx(ha_name)[source]¶
Parameters:ha_name – Name of Header Array.
Return int:The list index of the harpy.HeaderArrayObj.
getHeaderArrayObjs()[source]¶

Retrieve a list of harpy.HeaderArrayObj.

Parameters:ha_names – The name or list of names of harpy.HeaderArrayObj. If None is provided (the default) then all harpy.HeaderArrayObj are returned.
Returns:list of harpy.HeaderArrayObj.
getRealHeaderArrayNames()[source]¶
Returns:Returns only the names of arrays of type 2D or 7D - i.e. multi-dimensional header arrays of floating point numbers.
static loadFromDisk(filename: str) → harpy.har_file.HarFileObj[source]¶

Loads a HAR file into memory, returning a HarFileObj. :param filename: The name of the file to load. :return:

readHeaderArrayObjs()[source]¶
Parameters:ha_names – Reads the header array objects with names ha_names from filename. If None (the default), read all header array objects. harpy.HeaderArrayObj are stored in self and can be retrieved with the self.getHeaderArrayObjs() method.
Returns:None
removeHeaderArrayObjs()[source]¶
Parameters:ha_names – Remove one or more harpy.HeaderArrayObj from self.
writeToDisk()[source]¶
Parameters:filename – Writes harpy.HeaderArrayObj with ha_names to filename. If ha_names is None, write all the harpy.HeaderArrayObj stored in self.
